content.detailedDescription: I was observing how thin the moon was and a jet that was flying east, with obvious trails behind it and blinking lights, when i lost sight of the jet an object appeared on the western horizon and moved north-east. for approximately 5 minutes the object moved across the sky before it was lost from view and obscured by trees. it had no blinking lights, made no sound and had no obvious wings, unlike the jet. i was not scared, but fascinated. i spent the afternoon telling my brother about previous experiences and then joked that they were listening to me from my implant from a childhood abduction, which he remembers as well. my niece claimed to see a ufo while we were discussing it. i dont like to sound paranoid, but i feel i am being observed.
content.summary: Walking home an object move across the sky from the western horizon traveling north-east and was lost in the trees

content.detailedDescription:
Condado, puerto rico at 4:39 am i saw two circular orange lights. the first one pass from east to west a very low speed and then disappear at the same time i saw a airplane towards san juan but far away( the pilots must have seen the lights). then the second one appears in the same spot the the first one appears for the first time. the second make the same exact path that the first one make (like the exact replay) of the first. this video is from the second one. they do not make any sound, the inside of the circle is like more fire color and the exterior is more orange red color. 


note: the ufo appears at he first of the video a very tiny point.. the light at the left is a light pole
content.summary: Round yellow- arange ball like fire move from east to west

content.detailedDescription: We have noticed this object flying by over our house about the same time each time we have seen it. it's very bright as if the sunset is reflecting off of it however if it was a plane you should be able to see the wings. well tonight we saw it again. one went over our house, same flight path as others we've seen, no sound, no visible wings, appears to have red on the surface. one flew over then we looked up and saw another one heading our way. same flight path as the first. i ran got my camera and took a pic. the object focused very well in camera but blurred before i could get a snapshot. it was sliver, no wings, no obvious windows or tail, or trail. it had two groved areas around the middle like the belly was groved or dipped inward. this is where the red color was from. as it passed over our roof we ran to the front yard to try to catch it and get another pic but it disappeared. very clear blue sky at about close to sunset is when we saw it and have seen them each time.
content.summary: 2 object flying one behind the other no sound, no wings, sunset reflecting off of them, took pic with camera, object very silver, groved center, no wings

content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside, looked up, and could see a slowish moving white light. no sound, no vapor trail and no distinguising characteristics. i.E typical red, blue, green and white flashing lights. flight path was direct but approximately 5 minutes after i observed it, the white light abruptly disappeared which seemed to be directly over o'hare airport.
content.summary: White light. not a plane or helo

content.detailedDescription: My daughter saw a light that zig zagged in the nite sky- she took some pics with her phone that show something that i would describe as a lighted craft appearing to dock with triangular mother ship- its kinda fuzzy but if u blow it up a bit u can see this object is strange to say the least-what do u guys think - there are some more pics i cud send if u think its worth persuing
content.summary: Zig zagging light taken with phone cam when enhanced dicovered triangle behind light can send pics if u want

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 2:30 pm in april 1998, i was driving north on hwy 99 in sacramento approaching the interchange with hwy 50.  i love looking at puffy white clouds and i noticed a "parade" of small to medium low hanging, puffy, white clouds moving in an eastward direction, roughly along the path of eastbound hwy 50. as i made the turn east on to hwy 50, i noticed a small white cloud drop to the bottom of the other clouds and it started pacing my car.  as i sped up to catch up with traffic, it sped up and started passing the other clouds as well as passing through them.  it traveled through larger, low hanging clouds and came out the other side of those clouds in the same shape as it went in. i kept looking around wondering if anyone else noticed the cloud.  as i slowed down to exist the freeway at watt ave, it slowed down and continued floating with the rest of the clouds down the freeway.
content.summary: Small cloud following a vehicle while traveling through other clouds at same rate as vehicle

content.detailedDescription: At about 9:30pm on june 19, and 20th, i was looking west and low on the horizon and i saw 4-5 bright, intermittently flashing lights moving in the sky above rocklin or lincoln, ca (i couldn't tell how far away they were).  they looked similar to stars or planets from my vantage point but they moved in an nonrandom manner.  they would move away from each other, then they would come back together getting very close.  i thought i would see them merge together but that did not happen.  most interestingly, 3 of the orbs would form a flat, slightly slanted triangle, keep this shape, rotate the triangle a few times, and separate.  this is a very clear event i have witnessed over the last two nights at the same time and i can't believe no one else has reported it as it is very obvious that these are anomalous.  i first saw them on 6/19/12, was so amazed i thought i look into the sky again the next night.  sure enough, they were there again and doing the same things. i am going back out tonight to see if they are still there.
content.summary: 4 -5 flashing orbs

content.detailedDescription:
Up until late 2010 i worked in a shop located on prescot road in the old swan district of liverpool. i commuted by bus daily, on the number 60, and got off on derby lane to walk the quarter of a mile to my work.

the day in question was warm and the sky was clear blue, i cannot recall seeing a cloud.

that morning i walked down the road and crossed over the road and walked past the masons pub, as i approached the bus stop by the nationwide bank i noticed  a number of people at the bus stop ( a man,a woman and about 4 school kids)all looking in the direction of the block of flats called baden house.
one of the young lads had his mobile phone out and had it pointed up toward that way, i followed their gaze and saw in the distance a cigar shaped craft which was stationary,it looked like it was about a mile away and in my vision was about the size of a grain of rice, i don't know how big that would make it? the craft looked solid and was dull grey in colour but looked like it was reflecting the suns light off part of it. i walked toward the man at the bus stop and asked him "you see that!" . he looked at me and nodded, i looked back and the object was moving slowly to the right, i suddenly thought about getting a video on my phone, i reached into my pocket keeping my eye on the craft, almost the same instant i pulled my phone out of my pocket the craft which was still traveling left to right suddenly shot at an impossible speed back left until i lost sight of it as the buildings obstructed my view. this caused a great deal of excitement to everyone who had seen it, and i left the people at the stop to walk fast in the direction of my work and to see if i could see anything further down the road. i got to my place of work but could see nothing. i scoured the papers and internet for any mention of what happened but was shocked to find nothing despite the road being very busy at the time, and i knew at least 6 other people had seen the same thing!
content.summary: Cigar shaped ufo over old swan/dovecot liverpool

content.detailedDescription: While inside my friends apartment i noticed the time was 1:11pm. the tv and radio as well as the internet began to go crazy. i had the urge to go outside. i waited a few more minutes and then listened closely for the sounds of jets or airplanes flying by. the sound was very loud so i knew that it was no airplane. i finally walked outside and looked up to see where the noises were coming from. i could not see what had just passed but the next sound was louder than the first. i saw a triangle shpaed metal object flying very fast overhead. i asked my friend to come outside and witness. he ooked up and immediatly was amazed at what we were seeing. he then ran inside to get his sunglasses and noticed a bright circle with pinkish like fog or haze around it. we observed in total 5 metal triangles. it was very cloudy today which is no accident i assume and found it very difficult to see where they disappeared to. the noise immediately vanished after 5-10 seconds.I observed a very puffy cloud that looked like a "turtle  being stood on" raise up into another smaller turtle then float up more into a smaller yet fluffier cloud. it looked like the funnel from the movie thor raising above the last cloud.
content.summary: Jet-like noise in sky. 4-5 things flew by. i saw a triangle like jet making no sound just coasting flying very fast.

content.detailedDescription:
It was a moonless night, and i was out sky watching with a friend between 10pm-3am. there appeared to be a lot of satellites traversing the sky, i counted more than 20, but only a couple of them traversed the sky in a straight and unwavering path as satellites do. we both had green laser pointers to point them out to each other, when suddenly one of the dim "satellites" i had pointed to flashed brightly back at me and stopped its forward motion. thinking it was a fluke, i shone the laser back at it, and it again flashed brightly back. did this several times, and each time the object flashed back at me, and then dimmed to where it could not be seen.

saw one very bright egg-shaped object just over the foothills near hogsback, traveling south at a slow speed. flashed the laser at it, it sped up. flashed again, and it turned east and traveled very quickly out of sight. many more of the objects either did not react or did not keep a straight pattern of flight or constant speed when hit with the laser. several just went dark and unseeable.

saw a triangle of 3 lights over the western foothills. two lights white, one light changing slowly from red to green to white. big round lights, no rays like is usual with aircraft lights. it would travel a ways, make a banking turn right or left, travel a ways, come back, circle again. did not have the laser light to see if it would react--this was on a different night around june 12.

devlin, call me. i lost your number and email addy. we really should talk....
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Multiple sightings of sentient and reactive lights in the sky

content.detailedDescription: Prevent "back" test
content.summary: Prevent "back" test

content.detailedDescription:
1. i was living in albuquerque around tramway and academy. i was out in the backyard and it was a clear starry night.

2. i suddenly had an urge to look up and notice the object.

3. i thought it was an alien spaceship.

4. it was  a gigantic triangle appearing to be as big if not bigger than a football field.
the craft had a bright light at each corner. it flew right over me very slowly not making a single sound. it was flying in a straight trajectory from south to north until it was out of sight.

5. i felt amazed and in awe of this craft. i watched it for about a minute ran inside were my family was watching t.V. and excitedly told them to come outside to see the craft. they blew it of so i begged my mother to come outside she did i pointed at the object and said what is that? she said she had no idea watched it for about a minute and went back inside.

6. it slowly cruised out of sight to the north.

there was another sighting when i was about 10 or 11 years old of a blue tear drop shaped object that was stationary in the  clear night sky and then disappeared and reappeared over the sandia mountains about 15 miles away  in the blink of the eye
content.summary: Gigantic black triangle, lights on each corner black out stars in clear sky.

content.detailedDescription: 2 friends and myself went out for a ride to go do a spot of fishing. we knew of this nice quiet place about 20 or so miles from town.We got there,unloaded the vehicle,got a small camp fire going and my friend's girlfriend who did not fish that night made a coment on how nice the scenery was and how all the stars seem to light up.Well dark came and as we were packing up our poles we decided to just hang out for awhile and admire the view when we all seen these 3 lights in the sky that resembeled a triangle ,these lights did not blink but there were other lights on this craft that did blink.We viewed this event for about 5 minutes until we could not see it anymore.What ever it was sure was pretty.
content.summary: Triangle

content.detailedDescription:
We were sitting on the balcony of our hotel on the beach at approximately 10pm when my daughter saw an orangish, red light in the sky above the ocean. there were four of us there and at first we didn't see the light when she pointed to the sky but then it reappeared a few seconds later and all four of us saw it.  

it resembled a star although it was orange-red instead of white and brighter than the stars.  it seemed to flicker and almost "burn out" and then would reappear in the same spot.  it resembled a flare but it stayed in the same place and didn't appear to be moving.  it appeared and disappeared in the same spot for what seemed like about 2 or 3 minutes.  

after that time, it reappeared to the right (what looked like quite a far distance from the original position) of where it had originally been and then split into two lights.  then the lights then disappeared.

there were no planes in the area while we saw the lights, but soon after the lights disappeared a couple of planes flew into the area to land at the airport nearby.  we were out for approximately another 30-45 minutes and didn't see the lights again.

unfortunely we only had a camera phone and it was dark so we couldn't get any pictures that would show the object(s) we saw.
content.summary: Flickering orange-red orb/light that split into 2

content.detailedDescription:
Went to have a cigarette in my backyard, i was sitting facing directly westwards. a "large flash" way up and to my right (north) caught my attention. it made me jump slightly as i thought someone had thrown and exploded an m80 up there, but, there was no sound. looking around, there was no one else to be seen or heard, looking back up, there was a bright speck that didn't seem to move. watching for half a min as i realized that the speck wasn't getting larger as much as it was moving in my direction, getting closer. i ran into my house for my 45x binoculars. which took less than half a min. the light was now close enough for me to discern a shape. it was now about 50degrees up from the northern horizon. i was way to excited as it approached, 60, 70, 80, degrees closer to above me.
    by its 70 degree position, a red, a blue, and a white (most aircraft lights are discern able, much farther away) could be noticed flashing on the ufo.
    since 9/11, (dissapointingly and oddly, within two weeks of this sighting, i could no longer recall if it happened 2weeks ago or 4weeks ago) although i did call coast to coast that night asap, to ask if anyone else was mentioning the event)(i asked tom "off the air")(no one else was reporting)(and now, its been so long a time, it may have been anywhere from the last two weeks of oct. to the first two weeks of nov. 2001) the military had 24hr air patrol, circular clockwise around a nuclear power plant far to my south west. i could only see the fighter aircraft on its (about) 1oclock to 4oclock 'leg of patrol'.
     the fighter was just past it's 1oclock position, when the "flash occurred in the sky". it broke off from its patrol pattern around the 2oclock position, and was turning towards the "path" of the ufo. an intercept course is calculated by radar equipment, isn't it.
     the "saucer shape" of the ufo became obviouse when it was about 80degrees up. the three blinking lights triangular positions within a circular patern about 1/3 of the crafts diameter. it's relative size, (the ufo being somwhere between me and the moon) was about 2/3s the size of the moon. at the same time, the ufo just barely filled the lens of my 45x glasses when it was directly above me. (a math person could probably determine an exact size).
    i could not hear it making any sounds, and i have very good reaching. there was a haze surrounding ufo, but i couldn't say if it caused by the craft, or simply the amount of  our atmosphere particulates at the time.
   about twenty seconds later it had gone past my southeastern horizon, and the fighter aircraft apparently was returning to its patrol. the saucer had traveled so far ahead of the fighter.
   i was a radar-man in the navy, so when i got back into my house, i immediately began trying to determine the ufo's course. the flash could have been about 70 miles north west of detroit (say about 300 degrees using a compass, on a course putting it between d.C. and norfolk.
  should i include the pilot of the aircraft as a witness? the chain-of-command need to snd the pilot on an intercept course. i don't know of any other witnesses.
   it was identical to the ufo's in a recent ytube release, where a couple of fighters seem to be following that ufo. and identical to "filmed footage" from the 60s of a saucer going into the tree line in some n.Western state.
content.summary: It moved from above northern horizon, to directly above, to south east horizon

content.detailedDescription: Saw a object moving left to right near roswell - then stopped and hovered and then disappeared. lasted only a few moments. at first -thought it might be a airplane or something like that - then it moved slowly as if searching and then completely disappeared. i continued to drive to see if i could see it again - with no luck.
content.summary: Saw it move from left to right -stop and then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: I was walking to the convenience store, and saw something in the sky last night at about 11:00pm in aurora ontario. i happened to look up, and saw a bright light (brighter and larger than a star) that was moving eastward across the sky at a steady pace. at first, i thought it was a satellite,i don't think it actually was a satellite, as they tend to look further away and travel in a straight line. the object that i saw was travelling relatively straight but would sort of 'jump' off course every 20-30 seconds. my sighting lasted for about 3 minutes, and then the object started to disappear until all i could see was a very faint flickering light which then travelled upwards in the direction of a rather strange looking "star" until it was no longer visible..... this "star" is a flickering/colour changing light in the sky that has been visible for a few months now, but i'm not exactly sure what it is. it kinda' freaked me out a little bit.
content.summary: Walking to the convenience store, saw a bright moving light in the sky which then ascended to the point where it was barely visible

content.detailedDescription:
10pm, wednesday, june 20, 2012 - summer solstice

slightly hazy atmosphere, with no clouds or precipitation. approximately 70 degrees f. 

in a grassy field behind edison community college in piqua, ohio.

facing east was what appeared to be the brightest star in the sky (the object) about 35-40 degrees above the horizon. white/blue steady light with an occasional flash/pulse.

the object was fully visible upon our arrival at 10pm and appeared to be a star.

at 10:13pm the object moved sw for about one minute then moved nw (in an s pattern) at an accelerated pace for another thirty seconds before becoming motionless. note that two planes (visible by their flashing wing lights) crisscrossed the object's original area just before it moved. this could be coincidental but it gave the impression of the object 'avoiding' the two planes. 

at 10:20 after seven minutes of stillness, the object moved, again towards the sw, then to the nw, then to the sw at an accelerated pace, then back nw, then as it slowed to a crawl it inched due w for half a minute and stopped. object then dimmed in brightness almost to the point of vanishing, then over the course of around two minutes it slowly regained it's previous level of brightness. 

during this time a bright orange second object appeared from the south and moved straight north. the speed of the second object began fast but slowed as it's light faded until it disappeared completely. total viewing time of second object about one minute. 

the first object remained motionless at least until we left at 11:05. 

note: the car wouldn't start for several minutes. cause unknown. once at home, car started fine. 

in answer to the 6 sidebar questions:
1 i was lying in a field star gazing with my nine year old son.
2 i noticed the object when my son asked me why a star was moving.
3 i thought it was a star. the brightest in the sky.
4 detailed above.
5 disbelief, confusion.
6 did not lose sight of the object. after watching it for nearly an hour we simply decided to go home (my son was hungry and we were being eaten by mosquitoes). tried to film it but to no avail.
content.summary: What appeared to be a star moved several times with multiple direction changes/stops

content.detailedDescription:
My son and i had been observing many orbs and other unknown flying objects on this very active sky watching night. as we sat with our binoculars in hand we observed a very low glowing orb coming from the west heading east. 
it's movement was slow and graceful as it headed in our direction. it made no sound and had no structural form other than a glowing circle.
as it moved closer it became somewhat brighter. approximately 2 minutes of observance had passed at this point. my son then ran in to tell my boyfriend to come out to see the low flying object. approximately 1 more minute had passed during this time.
i continued to observe the object with my binoculars. they returned and we watched as the object slowed down and then became extremely brilliant in brightness. at this point the object was directly over our home. i am not a good distance estimator but i will say it was flying at the same height that a hot air balloon might fly at. 
another minute passed and then the object (which had almost come to a complete stop at this point) began to move quickly toward the east dimming as it quickly sped away and then suddenly disappeared.
it was amazing.
i had goose bumps my son's heart was racing in excitement and my boyfriend was in awe.
content.summary: A glowing light flew toward my home in a gentle glider-like movement got extremely bright over my home then quickly flew away, dulled and disappeared

content.detailedDescription:
Sf bay area - i stepped out on my patio at approximately 0125 hours pacific time and was just looking around the sky since i'm up all night listening to the radio online. i saw what i thought at first was an passenger airplane until i noticed that it was not moving at all. it was just hanging in the sky motionless. i watched it for approximately one minute to confirm it was not moving... then went inside and grabbed my bino's. i got a clear look at a craft which had 3 bright white lights. it was an elongated oval with the 3 bright lights spaced evenly on it. i could make out an outline of the oval as well. i watched it for several minutes with my bino's and it remained motionless in the sky. the best way that i can describe the lights is as if seeing an auto's headlights thru a slight fog. this allowed me to see the outline of the object without the lights being to bright to do so. the object was dull gray in color.

i was amazed at my luck so i went inside to grab my camera or video recorder but both had dead batteries. i was only inside about 30 seconds... i went back outside to see it again and this time it was gone... not a trace. no man-made aircfaft could disappear from the sky that fast.

this object had been inside a slight low cloud cover which was moving briskly due to fast cold winds tonight. from where i was, the pan of the big dipper was behind this cloud cover and could not be seen through it. the cloud cover was there, and moving fast, the entire time i viewed this object... and like i said, the object was slightly inside the clouds but not deep inside because i could see it easily. after going inside for the camera the object was gone but the clouds were still moving fast. when the cloud cover past completely i could easily see the entire big dipper but there was nothing else there that could have been the the craft... so i know for sure it was not any star.

i will try and fax a sketch of the object to mufon if it can be arranged.
content.summary: Oval craft w/three white lights stationary and clearly just inside fast moving clounds. observed for several minutes but gone when i returned.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: Husband and i had just left gym when i had noticed a bright orange/red ball of fire-ish something in the sky. thought it was a plane for a brief second but quickly realized it wasnt that. then noticed it was pulsating but was way too bright to be a star. husband had then noticed others were outdoors looking at the sky and pointing as well. then as quickly as it had appeared,  it just dimmed a little and quickly disappeared...Completely gone.
content.summary: Noticed large round orange ball of fire in night sky

content.detailedDescription: While looking up at clouds about 5pm saw what appeared to be a disc shaped craft approx. 2 miles high, dark in color, on the side of a large cloud...Craft was traveling very slowly.....Est. about 50 mph....It gradually slowed and came to a stop and hovered. i watched for a few seconds then i ran indoors to get my camera...Came back and managed to get a few pics....Then ran to knock on the door of a neighbor to get a witness...He wasnt home. i returned right away to watch the craft but it had disappeared so i didnt get to see in which manner it departed. im attaching photos. im estimating the craft was about 50ft diameter so at approx. 2 miles altitude(difficult to judge) and if it was 2 miles high, thats how i judge the object/craft to be approx. 50ft diameter.  pics dont show much after theyre enlarged...Too pixelated.(also an indication craft was only 50ft dia.)
content.summary: Dark or gray disc shaped approx 50ft dia.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving (north) to orlando from kissimmee on john young pkwy. the date was 01/20/12 at about 12:45am. as i was driving, i saw decided to look upward and to the right (through my windshield) and i saw a small circle of light at nimbus cloud height zooming faster than a plane or a helicopter at that altitude (relative to its distance from me; from my experience). i only saw it for a second as it went right into a cloud and was not seen again. i was traveling at approximately 50 mph, the object was traveling faster than i at it's height.
content.summary: Yellow circle of light zoomed  northward over orlando, fl.

content.detailedDescription: I was at my girlfriend's college graduation open house and an orange orb was seen and caught the attention of a group of five people out in her parking lot including me.  this orb was dismissed as a glowing latern and people went back to the event.  i knew that it  this was not the case. i  stayed out and walked away from the parking lot light. i observed the orb start to head east towards kansas city at a rapid rate.  less than 5 minutes later i got a phone call from a friend in overland park a suburb of kc.  he said he saw an orange orb that he thought was watching him hovering above his house. he was outside on his back porch. this was strange because we have had a strange experience in rural missouri if he was seeing what the night before easter 2011.  we were going to bed and the room was dark as coal.  i noticed shadow figures above us i asked him if he saw what i saw. he said yes and one sarted to hover over him and i saw a shadow almost like a smoke cloud of an alien head with a small chin come at me from above and dissapear like smoke.  i yelled to turn on the lights.   we drew what we saw on napkins and went to bed again with no night light.  thena red dot appeared on the wall and a white dot later too going in circles after about 3 minutes the lights dissapeared and the room turned to particles like tars and my friend told me to put my finger out and the stars followed my finger like a comet. soon i asked if it was over and he said yes and we went to bed.  also the shadow figures were aparent throughout the whole experience.  it i strange that it was him who called out of all people and so quickly and so far away.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Orange orb seen by me then frantic phone call from friend seen 30 mi away 5 min later

content.detailedDescription: At 10:30pm myself and another person witnessed a red triangle with orange center appear from the southwest horizon in the direction of the niagara river it continued it's path heading northeast flying straight above us while sitting out back on our deck. the craft itself made no noise except for the hum of wind catching it and gained no altitude. as it grew closer the triangle seemed more curved almost oval but the color remained the same however the center seemed to be pulsating as well, where as before it seemed to steadily glow. the structure of the object seemed solid almost like a neon light filled with fire. after continuing northeast it gained altitude, perhaps even speed and marginally changed course east about a mile or two from where we were. the whole occurrence lasted roughly two minutes and we were able to catch a photo on a droid cell phone however the speed of the object and the camera's quality didn't capture anything near the image we witnessed. we were a bit excited so we decided to stay outside. after an hour of watching the sky we noticed a triangular bright light flying what would be below cloud coverage and noticeably higher than the first object. this triangle did not change shape it appeared from northwest in the direction of grand island and kept a straight path for about 30-40 seconds when the lights dimmed and then went out completely though we could still see the grey triangular  shape as it kept the same course out of sight.
content.summary: Two ufo's sighted with in hour apart.

content.detailedDescription: At 11:06 pm my friend and i observed a solid white light moving at a steady pace from west to east. the light did not blink or wink, but remained constant and bright. from my standpoint i would estimate the light to be at about cruising altitude if an airplane, 60,000 ft or so. i moved to watch the light as it moved overhead, and as i looked up, the light dimmed and then faded completely, as if the light were only on one side of the object. i sat down, still looking up and out over the horizon. looking out i briefly saw a distant white light moving north to south and then vanishing mid-flight. the first sighting lasted about 14-16 seconds, and the second object was in view for only 2 seconds or so. night was clear. no sound. first object was very bright.
content.summary: Sighted a solid, steadily moving white orb, altitude of approx 30,000 ft, moving east, over my location. light dimmed when directly over and then faded out completely. second light seen

content.detailedDescription:
Outside with a friend of mine, looked up at the stars as i usually do. when i noticed an object moving over 65 highway towards the springfield/branson airport before turning away and lowing its luminescence to that of a star. the object proceeded to change direction which is when i lost sight  behind some houses. this can be corroborated by someone who was with me.

at first i thought it was possibly a flame out on an airplane but the direction change took it away from the airport. there were no signal lights as you would typically see on an airplane/helicopter. 

when i first saw the object i was excited, this was purely a definition of a ufo, as a flying object which i could not identify. once it went out of view i moved to my front yard to try and see it again however i could not. afterwards there were some kind of short meteor shower, in a very specific area where i first saw the object. i am unsure if this was related, but it was very interesting to watch. 

i have taken a short video on my cell phone, however it is unworthy of view for i gave up filming it very quickly due to lack of clarity.
content.summary: Orange glowing fireball, turned to star before disappearing at high rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription: Saw a red looking star object rise above the horizon then shoot off very fast to the north east.  just after dark.
content.summary: Red star light

content.detailedDescription: Previous attempt at submitting video failed, included is the short 48 second clip i grabbed of it.
content.summary: Video for previous post

content.detailedDescription:
1. outside walking dogs
2. the brightness of the object, brighter then any star and going fast
3. weather balloon, satellite
4. seemed to be travelling in a straight line, i managed to catch video of it, but its brightness makes the rest of the sky appear black so you can only see the object
5. skeptical, but wanting to believe.
6. went inside to grab parents, object gone

48 second video recorded.
content.summary: Very bright orange object travelling fast across sky
